DataElement.preferredName: Optional Research Blood Sample Not Submitted Reason Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A free text field used to describe the reason an optional research blood sample was not submitted.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Optional Research Blood Sample Not Submitted
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information pertaining to a optional systematic investigation into a subject in order to discover facts, to establish or revise a theory, or to develop a plan of action based on the facts discovered liquid tissue taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis not submitted; referred for judgment or consideration.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Possible but not necessary; left to personal choice.:Systematic investigation into a subject in order to discover facts, to establish or revise a theory, or to develop a plan of action based on the facts discovered.

Concepts.definition: Possible but not necessary; left to personal choice.
Systematic investigation into a subject in order to discover facts, to establish or revise a theory, or to develop a plan of action based on the facts discovered.

Property.preferredDefinition: Blood circulating throughout the body.:A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.:An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:Submitted; referred for judgment or consideration.

Concepts.definition: A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
The act of referring for judgment or consideration by others; the act of handing over something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Blood Sample Not Submitted Reason Text
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A free text field used to describe the reason a blood sample was not submitted.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.:Text; the words of something written.

Concepts.definition: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.
